name: red_rooster
text:
"I CAN"T" buttons, anyone?
i'd wear it.

name: wulvaine
text: Wow, I totally missed that. That raised this strip from a 3 to a 4 for me.

name: drskradley
text: Still looks like "I CUNT" to me.  I know it's not and all, but that's what it looks like.

name: jaldor
text: "I <THE SMALLEST CUP AT 7-11>"

name: greenkoolayd
text: i dont get it.

name: ham_shoes
text: Gosh, I thought it said 1 cent

name: catachresis
text: Most of the guests strips I really don't like but this one hits the fucking mark. Great stuff.

name: methadone
text: A comment left by methadone was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Overmedicated, sharksarecoming, mustconcentrate, gardenhead_)

name: trollcollins
text:
Achewood haiku are
a fantastic idea.
I enjoy this strip.

name: closefriend
text: A comment left by closefriend was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by apocowarg, tttt2, wurlitzergirl, Bourbonsamurai, TheGreatestCape, eRiUukFJk)

name: trollcollins
text:
I say "I-de-a."
English is quite flexible;
we could both be right!

name: gormster
text:
I' DE a totally has
three (3) syllables
depending on
your definition
of syllable

(free verse)

name: straw
text:
Those are not haikus.
You're just counting syllables.
Stop that this instant.

name: charchar
text:
I come from Texas
My drawl is noticeable
One says "Ah-dee-ah"

name: greenkoolayd
text: tre sexy...

name: homepie
text: Holy crap, I just noticed that Ray and Roast Beef's word bubbles in the third panels are also haiku.

name: deusoma
text: AND they sound very much like what they would say in that situation. Is there some way I can give this one a 47/5?

name: ashoykh
text: Last panel Ray is very sexy.

name: jesler729
text: Oh jesus. Look at those curves.

name: joeyramoney
text: i notice lyle is utilizing a rare forehand bird.

name: serf
text: ray is such a lightweight

name: godfatherofsouls
text: he is a cat

name: rgiskard
text: Beef's whiskers are ruuuuude

name: rowboat
text: This strip is actually really well drawn. That's all I ask of a guest strip.

name: blarghamagarky
text: YEAH

name: blarghamagarky
text:
I am very down with this guest strip.
Panels 2 and 4 are quite appropriate and enjoyable though I guess I am always happy when Lyle's middle finger serves a punch line.
And yes well drawn

name: mnemodomi
text: i would like this if the ray and beef dialogue was not so flat

name: mnemodomi
text: but my esteem of it rises slightly in light of its haikuity

name: howl
text:
Gal thinks Jim Beam is handsomer than lad
It isn't bad

name: anabanananana
text: Does anyone else go through and count out the syllables in each line everytime they come across a haiku?  Particularly in an office building where people are apt to walk by and see you counting on your fingers in front of a cartoon?

name: howl
text: Oh yeah, I have to do that with every haiku I come across. Except for the actually, you know, Japanese ones, which are like never actually in the 5-7-5 pattern.

name: glorify
text: well of course they're not, they've been translated from English.

name: greenkoolayd
text: there are different meters for haiku(besides 5-7-5).

name: scorpio_nadir
text: I use the little abacus in my head.

name: fancyrat
text: I like the inclusion of LN's gangsta pants.

name: theguitarhero
text: I missed this one somehow.

name: gournal
text: And now someone is mad at you for it...
